Sri Mulyani Ungkap Sulitnya Tarik Pajak dari Netflix dan Spotify
04 Nov 2019, 11:43 by Hendra Kusuma


Foto: Edi Wahyono

Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati kembali menyoroti pajak perusahaan digital internasional yang meraup untung di Indonesia namun tidak membayarkan kewajiban pajaknya.Kali ini, Sri Mulyani menyebut Netflix dan Spotify yang berhasil meraup untung banyak di Indonesia. Hal itu diungkapkan saat menjawab beberapa pertanyaan anggota Komisi XI DPR mengenai pajak."Perusahaan digital banyak mendapatkan keuntungan, Netflix, Spotify," ujar Sri Mulyani, Senin (4/11/2019).Belum bisanya Pemerintah menarik pajak dari perusahaan digital lantaran tidak adanya kehadiran fisik di tanah air."Nggak akan bisa mungut pajak karena mereka nggak punya BUT (bentuk usaha tetap)," jelasnya.Menurut Sri Mulyani, Pemerintah tengah menyusun aturan perundang-undangan mengenai perpajakan yang salah satu isinya adalah mengenai skema pengenaan pajak bagi perusahaan digital."Kita ingin dalam uu itu, revenue kalian dapat dari sini, maka pajak harus bayar di sini," ungkap dia.Simak Video "Enggan Bayar Pajak, Bos Warung Bakso Ngamuk saat Didatangi Petugas"[Gambas:Video 20detik](hek/dna)

Sri Mulyani Reveals the Difficult Withdrawal of Taxes from Netflix and Spotify
Nov 04 2019, 11:43 by Hendra Kusuma


Photo: Edi Wahyono

Jakarta - Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati once again highlighted the taxation of international digital companies that reap profits in Indonesia but do not pay their tax obligations. This time, Sri Mulyani said that Netflix and Spotify have managed to reap huge profits in Indonesia. This was revealed when answering some questions from members of the House of Representatives Commission XI about taxes. "Digital companies get a lot of benefits, Netflix, Spotify," said Sri Mulyani, Monday (11/04/2019). "physically will not be able to collect taxes because they do not have permanent permanent establishment," he explained. According to Sri Mulyani, the Government was drafting legislation regarding taxation, one of which contained taxation schemes for companies digital. "We want in that money, your revenue can be from here, then taxes must pay here," he said.
